In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width - current_line_length
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        
        result *= " $word"
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1 # account for space character
    end
    
    return result[2:end] # remove leading whitespace in the first line
end
```

Here is an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
print(wrap_string(text))
```

This will print:

```plaintext
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
Sed do eiusmod
tempor incididunt
ut labore et
dolore magna aliqua.
```
